Package org.github.terminological.jepidemic.growth

Class GrowthRateEstimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.github.terminological.jepidemic.growth.GrowthRateEstimator

  • public class GrowthRateEstimator
extends Object
    An estimator of the reproduction number (\(R_t\)) using a renewal equation method. The renewal equation method depends on a time series of infections, and on the infectivity profile - a measure of the probability that a secondary infection occurred on a specific day after the primary case, given a secondary infection occurred. A Bayesian framework is then used to update a prior probabilistic estimate of \(R_t\) on any given day with both information gained from the time series of infections in the epidemic to date and the infectivity profile to produce a posterior estimate of \(R_t\). This is based on the article:

    A. GrowthRate, N. M. Ferguson, C. Fraser, and S. Cauchemez, ‘A New Framework and Software to Estimate Time-Varying Reproduction Numbers During Epidemics’, Am J Epidemiol, vol. 178, no. 9, pp. 1505–1512, Nov. 2013, doi: 10.1093/aje/kwt133.

    and the implementation of it in the R Library EpiEstim. It assumes that infections (or other type of observation) are a Poisson distributed process and that the reproduction number is a gamma distributed quantity. The estimates of \(R_t\) may be aggregated over a specific "window" to provide a more stable estimate.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GrowthRateEstimator

        public GrowthRateEstimator​(int minWindow,
                           int maxWindow)
        Produces a GrowthRateEstimator that is configured to behave in a sensible fashion, with sane defaults. In that it estimates an initial poisson rate prior from the first entry and returns a fixed window size and aggregates uncertain SI distributions with a random resampling strategy

        Parameters:
        infectivityProfiles - - a numeric matrix with the discrete probability distribution of the serial interval with \(P_{(t=0)} = 0\)
        minWindow - - the smallest amount of data considered in estimating the growth rate - 4 is a ssensible default unless you want bang up to date estimate.
        minWindow - - the largest amount of data considered in estimating the growth rate - 14 is a sensible amount .

      • strictGrowthRateAndRtEstimator

        public static GrowthRateEstimator strictGrowthRateAndRtEstimator​(int minWindow,
                                                                 int maxWindow,
                                                                 uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RNumericArray infectivityProfiles)
        Produces a GrowthRateEstimator that will estimate growth rate and $R_t$, with sane defaults. The $R_t$ estimation is done using bootstrapping, and combining the results using a mixture distribution. This will be relatively slow.
        Parameters:
        minWindow - - the smallest amount of data considered in estimating the growth rate - 4 is a ssensible default unless you want bang up to date estimate.
        minWindow - - the largest amount of data considered in estimating the growth rate - 14 is a sensible amount.
        infectivityProfiles - - a numeric matrix with each column containing a discrete probability distribution of the serial interval with \(P_{(t=0)} = 0\)
        Returns:
        a strict growth rate and $R_t$ estimator that accounts for uncertainty in the infectivity profile.

      • defaultGrowthRateAndRtEstimator

        public static GrowthRateEstimator defaultGrowthRateAndRtEstimator​(int minWindow,
                                                                  int maxWindow,
                                                                  double initialIncidence)
        Produces a GrowthRateEstimator that will estimate growth rate and $R_t$, with sane defaults. The $R_t$ estimation is done using a single infectivity profile and does not account for infectivity profile uncertainty. This is comparatively fast.

        Parameters:
        minWindow - - the smallest amount of data considered in estimating the growth rate - 4 is a ssensible default unless you want bang up to date estimate.
        minWindow - - the largest amount of data considered in estimating the growth rate - 14 is a sensible amount.
        infectivityProfiles - - a numeric matrix with each column containing a discrete probability distribution of the serial interval with \(P_{(t=0)} = 0\)
        Returns:
        a growth rate and $R_t$ estimator that does not account for uncertainty in the infectivity profile.

      • defaultGrowthRateEstimator

        public static GrowthRateEstimator defaultGrowthRateEstimator​(int minWindow,
                                                             int maxWindow)
        Produces a GrowthRateEstimator that will estimate growth rate only, with sane defaults, unless an infectivity profile is lated added

        Parameters:
        minWindow - - the smallest amount of data considered in estimating the growth rate - 4 is a ssensible default unless you want bang up to date estimate.
        minWindow - - the largest amount of data considered in estimating the growth rate - 14 is a sensible amount.
        Returns:
        a growth rate and $R_t$ estimator that does not account for uncertainty in the infectivity profile.

      • basicGrowthRateEstimator

        public static GrowthRateEstimator basicGrowthRateEstimator​()
        Produces a GrowthRateEstimator that will estimate growth rate only, with sane defaults, and estimating using windows between 4 and 14 days

        Returns:
        a growth rate and $R_t$ estimator that does not account for uncertainty in the infectivity profile.

      • withOutputQuantiles

        public GrowthRateEstimator withOutputQuantiles​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RNumericVector quantiles)
        Allows you to change the quantiles returned by the estimator. The defaults are c(0.025,0.05,0.25,0.5,0.75,0.95,0.975)
        Parameters:
        quantiles - the desired quantiles of the output
        Returns:
        a fluent method

      • withSaneDefaults

        public GrowthRateEstimator withSaneDefaults​()
        Provides a sensible baseline configuration for the estimator that involves estimating the poisson rate using the previous timestep's posterior with standard deviation scaled by a factor determined by the t-2 value. Multiple posterior estimates are combined using a weighted average based on a discretised normal distributed weight with mean of 7 and SD of 4.
        Returns:
        a fluent method

      • withInitialIncidence

        public GrowthRateEstimator withInitialIncidence​(double incidence)
        Allows configuration of the initial incidence. If this is omitted the initial incidence is guessed from the first entry in the timeseries
        Parameters:
        incidence -
        Returns:
        a fluent method

      • withGaussianEstimateWeighting

        public GrowthRateEstimator withGaussianEstimateWeighting​(double meanTau,
                                                         double sdTau)
        Allows configuration of the weighting of estimate combination for the weighted mixture combination. This uses a discretised normal distribution to generate values for the weighting. The weighting is applied to each supported estimate determined by the data window of that estimate. The default value is a mean of 7 and SD of 4
        Parameters:
        meanTau - the mean of the normal distribution of weights
        sdTau - the sd of the normal distribution of weights
        Returns:
        a fluent method

      • withEstimateWeighting

        public GrowthRateEstimator withEstimateWeighting​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RNumericVector weights)
        Allows configuration of the weighting of estimate combination for the weighted mixture combination. This assumes the weights are given as a vector where the first entry is the weight for an estimate using a data window of 1. The vector should be the same length as the maxWindow parameter used in configuring the GrowthRateEstimator or 14 if the defaults were used.
        Parameters:
        weights - - a vector of weights for each data window
        Returns:
        a fluent method

      • combineEstimatesWithWeightedMixture

        public GrowthRateEstimator combineEstimatesWithWeightedMixture​()
        Sets the estimator to use a weighted mixture to combine estimates based on the length of different data windows, using weights defined by withEstimateWeighting() or withGaussianEstimateWeighting(). If none is set the weighting defaults to a discretised normal distribution with mean of 7 an SD of 4.
        Returns:
        a fluent method

      • combineUsingOnlyFirstEstimate

        protected GrowthRateEstimator combineUsingOnlyFirstEstimate​()

      • priorIncidenceFromPreviousPosterior

        public GrowthRateEstimator priorIncidenceFromPreviousPosterior​(double multiplyingSDby)
        Select a prior estimate for the poisson rate by taking the previous posterior and multiplying the SD by a constant factor
        Parameters:
        multiplyingSDby - - factor to multiply SD by. Must be greater than or equal to 1.
        Returns:
        a fluent method

      • priorIncidenceFromScaledPreviousPosterior

        public GrowthRateEstimator priorIncidenceFromScaledPreviousPosterior​()
        Select a prior estimate for the poisson rate by taking the previous posterior and multiplying the SD by a factor determined by the difference between the t-1 and t-2 incidence. This allows for rapid rate of change to be detected and less weight given to the prior in this situation
        Returns:
        a fluent method

      • priorIncidenceFromPosteriorAndGrowthRate

        public GrowthRateEstimator priorIncidenceFromPosteriorAndGrowthRate​(double multiplyingSDby)
        Select a prior estimate for the poisson rate by taking the previous posterior and increasing it by the exponential previous posterior growth rate and multiplying the resulting disctribution by a constant factor. This is a mechanistic prior.
        Parameters:
        multiplyingSDby - - factor to multiply SD by. Must be greater than or equal to 1.
        Returns:
        a fluent method

      • priorIncidenceFromScaledPosteriorAndGrowthRate

        public GrowthRateEstimator priorIncidenceFromScaledPosteriorAndGrowthRate​()
        Select a prior estimate for the poisson rate by taking the previous posterior and increasing it by the exponential previous posterior growth rate and multiplying the resulting disctribution by a factor determined by the change in t-1 and t-2 indidence. This is a mechanistic prior.
        Returns:
        a fluent method

      • useAllPosteriorEstimates

        public GrowthRateEstimator useAllPosteriorEstimates​()
        The posterior estimates for each combination of data window and infectivity profile are all retained and combined
        Returns:
        a fluent method

      • usePosteriorEstimatesFromOneWindow

        public GrowthRateEstimator usePosteriorEstimatesFromOneWindow​(int tau)
        The posterior estimates for only one data window, but all infectivity profiles, are retained and combined. N.b. the same effect can be achieved by setting the minWindow and maxWindow in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        tau - the window width to retain.
        Returns:
        a fluent method

      • usePosteriorEstimatesWithEnoughData

        public GrowthRateEstimator usePosteriorEstimatesWithEnoughData​(int sumIncidence)
        The posterior estimates for data windows that include a reasonable amount of data are retained and combined. This suppresses noisy estimates made on a very few data points when incidence is low.
        Parameters:
        sumIndidence - - the minimum number of cases that must be observed in a data window before the estimate is ignored.
        Returns:
        a fluent method

      • withInfectivityProfile

        public GrowthRateEstimator withInfectivityProfile​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RNumericVector infectivityProfile,
                                                  boolean replace)
        Configure the estimator with an infectivity profile. At least one profile must be added for an estimate of R_t to be made
        Parameters:
        infectivityProfile - - A numeric vector of the daily discrete probability of a secondary infection event occurring given an infected individual. It is assumed that this vector starts at time zero with a probability of zero.
        replace - - replace the existing infectivity profile with this new one? if false then the profile is added to a list.
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • withInfectivityProfileMatrix

        public GrowthRateEstimator withInfectivityProfileMatrix​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RNumericArray infectivityProfiles)
        Configure the estimator with an infectivity profile by specifying it as a matrix. This will replace all previously set profiles.
        Parameters:
        infectivityProfiles - - A numeric array of the daily discrete probability of a secondary infection event occurring given an infected individual in each column. It is assumed that this vector starts at time zero with a probability of zero.
        Returns:
        The estimator itself (a fluent method)

      • estimateGrowthRate

        public uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe estimateGrowthRate​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe incidence,
                                                                      String dateColName,
                                                                      String incidenceColName)
        Estimates growth rate and, if configured with an infectivity profile, \(R_t\) for a one or more timeseries of infections in an epidemic. If the supplied dataframe is grouped it assumes ach grouping is a timeseries
        Parameters:
        incidence - - a dataframe containing at least 2 columns (one containing a date, the other a numeric count of cases). The dataframe may be grouped, in which case grouping is preserved, and each group is treated as a seperate time series
        dateColName - - the name of the date column
        incidenceColName - - the name of the incidence column
        Returns:
        a dataframe, containing a summary of the estimates of incidence, growth rate and \(R_t\) with mean, sd, and quantiles for each day.

      • estimateGrowthRateSingle

        public uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe estimateGrowthRateSingle​(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe incidence,
                                                                            String dateColName,
                                                                            String incidenceColName)
                                                                     throws IncompleteTimeseriesException
        Estimates \(R_t\) for a single timeseries of infections in an epidemic.
        Parameters:
        incidence - - a dataframe containing at least 2 columns (one containing a date, the other a numeric count of cases).
        dateColName - - the name of the date column
        incidenceColName - - the name of the incidence column
        Returns:
        a dataframe, containing either a summary of the estimates of \(R_t\) with mean, sd, and quantiles for each day, or a full breakdown of the component \(R_t\) estimates.
        Throws:
        IncompleteTimeseriesException - if the timeseries does not have contiguous dates
